ygData.subject: Re: Weapons that Cast Spells
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Okay, just so everyone knows: proc = procedure. In my opinion it sounds like it s a term ripped straight from DIKU mud, but it can be considered a common
ygData.messageBody:
> >I haven't been able to come up with a word that means the same thing - I
> >mean, really
> >proc vs. "magic weapon that casts a spell, too" is a bit prohibitive....
>
> Now there's a challenge for the creative minds of the collected bards.
> Find a term for this effect that's simple, elegant, poetic, accurate and
> intuitive.
>
> To me using "proc" is similar to using "snork". Both are equally
> meaningless to the uninitiated.

Okay, just so everyone knows: proc = procedure. In my opinion it sounds like
it's a term ripped straight from DIKU mud, but it can be considered a common
programming term. A procedure is merely a block of code.

Why do you need a better term? You don't. Deal with it. A proc is a proc,
don't screw up the jargon.
